entry.title: Move affiliations into its own component.
entry.content:
The motivation for this CL is as follows:

Currently, password manager is the only component using affiliations.

Soon, this will change - plus_addresses will do the same. Since there

is no natural reason for plus_addresses to depend on password_manager,

this CL creates its own separate component for the affiliation service.



Despite its size, this CL does very little:

- It moves //components/password_manager/core/browser/affiliation

into its own components with the exception of AffiliationPrefetcher

and AffiliatedMatcherHelper which contain PWM-specific logic. It also

moves the SQLTableBuilder helper there.

- It adjusts build files, includes, and namespaces accordingly.

- It adds DEPS, metadata and OWNERs information to the new component.

- It adds a README.



Further mechanical follow-up CLs will:

- Also move the factories in the embedder into their own /affiliations

subdirectory.

- Move affiliations-related constants (AFAICT there is only one) into

their own constants-file.

- Potentially move affiliations-related histograms into their own

histograms file.



There will be further work required to actually make affiliations

usable for plus addresses (e.g., adjust affiliations prefetching,

introduce affiliations matching logic specific to plus_addresses, etc.)



Note: Skipping presubmits because the DEPS check does not understand

earlier +1s that got invalidated due to the addition of a single file.



Bug: b/324553078

Change-Id: I817dabe82a12fe25f3ede7b2d7d646fb660c4896

No-Presubmit: true

entry.title: [Compose] Call ExtractForm() for the field's FormGlobalId
entry.content:
The FormGlobalId passed to ExtractForm() determines which

render frame and which DOM elements in that renderer to extract.



ExtractForm() does not re-extract the whole browser form (because

the browser form may not be known). To do that, we have

TriggerFormExtractionIn{AllFrames,DriverFrame}().



So in order re-extract the form of a given FormFieldData, we

need to call ExtractForm(FormFieldData::renderer_form_id()).



Bug: 40072808

Change-Id: I655e83feb49338d70c40a01b296161020082a6f9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5295500

Commit-Queue: Christoph Schwering

Reviewed-by: Jan Keitel

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1260943}

entry.title: [UNO] Implement Sign in paused infra
entry.content:
This CL ensures no crash is introduced in the `TurnSyncOnHelper`. The

`TurnSyncOnHelper` relied on the `SigninManager` to clear the primary

account if the account removed on abort is the primary account. This is

to avoid the account reconcilor crashes. With Uno, the `SigninManager`

will no longer be created as the primary account should be set/cleared with

explicit user action in Chrome UIs.



Instead this CL checks if the account being removed is the primary

account and calls `ClearPrimaryAccount()`. This is CL (1) to support Uno

sign in paused state.



Bug: b/319402216

entry.title: picker: Prevent `StopCrosQuery()` from rendering empty results
entry.content:
Before this CL, we had logic to prevent showing empty CrOS search

results by showing fake results immediately after

`PickerClient::StopCrosQuery()`.



However, `StopCrosQuery()` still may have called the previous search

callback with a matching links section with empty results, causing

re-renders and confusing behaviour - especially when measuring the

latency between searches.



Fix this by ensuring that the previous callback is never called during

`StopCrosQuery()`, by resetting the stored callback before calling

`StopCrosQuery()`. This means that `PickerSearchController` could be in

a state where `RunCallback()` is called a null `current_callback_`,

which was not the case before this CL. If this occurs, gracefully fail

by not doing anything.



Bug: b:316936687

Change-Id: Idc5294595f74e5804a73e568810f0e6cd750a356

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5298481

Reviewed-by: Darren Shen

Commit-Queue: Michael Cui

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1260927}

entry.title: Revert "Add AdTagged metric to popup/redirect heuristic cookie access UKMs."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 1b9fe284d8c4d8b59f303790bae83ed243552c42.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5652972228837376



Sample build with failed test: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8756077425862210721

Affected test(s):

[ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/OpenerHeuristicBrowserTest.PopupPastInteractionIsFollowedByPostPopupCookieAccess](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest:browser_tests%2FOpenerHeuristicBrowserTest.PopupPastInteractionIsFollowedByPostPopupCookieAccess?q=VHash%3A6d0a43807ac672d9)



If this is a false positive, please report it at http://b.corp.google.com/createIssue?component=1199205&description=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Ftest-analysis%2Fb%2F5652972228837376&format=PLAIN&priority=P3&title=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5272190&type=BUG



Original change's description:

> Add AdTagged metric to popup/redirect heuristic cookie access UKMs.

>

> This will help estimate what % of cookies allowed by heuristics are then blocked by ad-tagging. We are collecting other metrics for ad-tagging on page load as well, but this is the only place we can derive the 3P site from the metrics, since we emit a linked UKM event on the 3P top level.

>

> UKM reviews:

> Opener/Popup: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GJBMYuhl77eTSjLMMEtq1Y2Kd3Vdv1ozfdFi1iCueZI

> Redirect:

> https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dogmwtbUU0MEwL5RKICv47Ly_RnxBJhRuJHvMwsKrqs

entry.title: [soft navigations] Refactor nested EventScopes
entry.content:
Previously, we tracked both a deque of EventParameters for nested event

scopes, the top EventParameters, and the current event EventParameters.

This can be simplified by putting the initial and nested EventParameters

in the deque, and then defining the current parameters as the deque's

back(). This CL does that as well as moves the EventScope complexity to

the SoftNavigationHeuristics class. Finally, this makes a few methods

used during scope construction/destruction private, since they are not

part of the public API.



Note: this CL swaps the order of calling SetCurrentTimeAsStartTime()

and popping the nested EventParameters since the former relies on

the latter. This appears to be a bug, although previously we didn't

clear the last entry (so the behavior didn't change for the last call/

outermost scope).



Bug: 324111878

Change-Id: Id68121450136bde1d7d56dd3c584797dbb002958

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5242021

Reviewed-by: Ian Clelland

entry.title: Allow sources to customize trigger data values and cardinality
entry.content:
https://github.com/WICG/attribution-reporting-api/pull/1129



This enables parsing and use of two new source-registration fields:

trigger_data and trigger_data_matching.



We use the existing TriggerSpecs type for parsing and Mojo

serialization, but return an internal error from storage if there are

multiple specs, since persistence and business logic for such a

configuration are not yet supported. (That is part of Full Flex.)



We move the existing Full Flex parsing code to a test-only method to

make it clear that it is not ready for general use; this allows us to

remove the "trigger config" feature that otherwise protected that code.



We avoid having to populate the new trigger_data proto field for

existing sources by treating absence of the field as equivalent to

specifying the default trigger-data cardinality for the source's source

type. We nonetheless bump the DB version to ensure that browser

downgrades do not result in this new field being ignored for sources

that *do* use non-default trigger data, because we raze the DB if the

version is too new.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Conversions.SourceRegistrationError10]=Replaced by Conversions.SourceRegistrationError11

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[CorruptReportsInDatabase4]=Replaced by CorruptReportsInDatabase5



Bug: 1497993

entry.title: [soft navigations] Refactor SoftNavigationEventScope creation
entry.content:
(1) Make SoftNavigationEventScope STACK_ALLOCATED:



SoftNavigationEventScope is currently heap allocated (not Oilpan) with

lifetime tied to a unique_ptr, which allows the scope to be null if

certain conditions aren't met, e.g. the feature is disabled. But all

scopes are actually tied to the lifetime of a function, and furthermore

the scopes should not span multiple tasks (should not be async). We

can get the same behavior using std::optional and making the scopes

STACK_ALLOCATED, which makes the lifetime clearer and predictable.



(2) Make SoftNavigationEventScope closer in line with TaskScope:

- Make it an inner class of SoftNavigationHeuristics (::EventScope)

- Make the constructor private and create via

SoftNavigationHeuristics::CreateEventScope(). In a follow-up CL,

cleaning up nested EventScopes, I'll move some of the complexity to

SoftNavigationHeuristics, which will help focus and shrink the

public API.



While a minor improvement in and of itself, this is also a small step

in unblocking refactoring multiple TaskAttributionTracker::Observers,

which is needed for crbug.com/40942324 (simplifying the task attribution

task graph).



Bug: 324111878

Change-Id: Ifb5ee3c3ba978f8d664face904307fdce8116a68

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5241861

Reviewed-by: Nate Chapin

entry.title: [Android TRM] Integrate with Magic Stack.
entry.content:
This CL changes the Tab Resumption Module from an NTP-only standalone

module to a module within the Magic Stack, though shown on the NTP

only.



Known issues to be addressed in future work on the Magic Stack:

* The refresh button on the NTP no longer refreshes the TRM. Re-enabling

this will require updating Magic Stack to handle refreshes.

* With Magic Stack shown, disabling "Sync everything" hides the TRM

(as required), but re-enabling "Sync everything" does not bring

the TRM back immediately.



New feature: Long-click on the TRM shows context menu with

{"Hide tabs from other devices" , "Customize"} items to control feature

visibility.



Details:

* Remove standalone TRM from the NTP:

* NewTabPageLayout: Remove all use, including SuggestionClickCallback

taken from CTOR.

* Utils: Remove mayCreateTabResumptionModuleCoordinator().

* Integrate into Magic Stack:

* Update TabResumptionModuleView layout to include margins.

* HomeModulesCoordinator: Change getModuleList() to initialize general

module list item-by-item, to simplify logic. Also include TRM in

Start Surface.

* Add TabResumptionModuleBuilder implementing ModuleProviderBuilder:

* Takes over Coordinator and View creation.

* Performs explicit bind().

* isEligible(): Replaces shouldShowTabResumptionModule() from Util.

* Coordinator:

* Implement ModuleProvider.

* Decouple from View and PropertyModelChangeProcessor

* Take ModuleDelegate in CTOR and use it for URL click.

* Mediator:

* Add helpers for Coordinator use.

* Takes ModuleDelegate. On suggestions load, remove the TRM if data

unavailable (no un-hide since API is not yet present); call

onDataReady().

* ViewBinder: Decouple from ViewBinder and change bind() to static, to

follow Magic Stack requirements.

* TileViewer: Add explicit long-click handler that just returns false.

This is needed to prevent tiles (which handle click) from blocking

long-click context menu.

* Tests:

* Mediator: Minor update to pass ModuleProvider; most work were done

in crrev.com/c/5281359.



Bug: 1515325

Change-Id: I69d05cc21978a9a0816abc1867318eb7d51febc5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5297855

Reviewed-by: Xi Han

entry.title: Allow creating GLSurface for EGLANGLE
entry.content:
GLImplementation can be set to gl::kGLImplementationEGLANGLE from

GLDisplayEGL::InitializeDisplay if platform graphic driver is angle

since client extension includes "EGL_ANGLE_platform_angle

EGL_ANGLE_platform_angle_device_type_egl_angle

EGL_ANGLE_platform_angle_vulkan"

Therefore it is required to allow creating GLSurface for the

gl::kGLImplementationEGLANGLE.

Reason for revert: Fix broken tests. The previous CL had assumed that

all interaction with feature_engagement::Tracker was through the

FeaturePromoController; it was not. Tests for code that communicated

directly with Tracker have been reverted.

entry.title: [wptrunner] Allow OK for `[ Failure ]` TestExpectations lines
entry.content:
This is a forward-fix for an edge case in https://crrev.com/c/5112639.

When a test has both a `[ Failure ]` TestExpectation and a baseline

harness error, the former should override the latter and expect OK to

avoid triggering retries and shard failure [0].



Reset some wdspec expectations that run expectedly OK.



[0]: https://luci-milo.appspot.com/ui/inv/task-chromium-swarm.appspot.com-67c1e5f865702511/test-results?sortby=&groupby=&q=external%2Fwpt%2Fwebdriver%2Ftests%2Fbidi%2Fbrowsing_context%2Flocate_nodes%2Fmax_node_count.py+



Bug: 40943761

entry.title: Add a skeleton of the UTR tool at //tools/utr/
entry.content:
This tool will be used to repro compile and test failures seen on

bots. It'll be driven mostly by a custom recipe that wraps the main

chromium recipe that ~all browser bots runs.



This initial commit simply:

- creates the dir, and adds a README and a relevant OWNERS

- creates a run.py that will serve as the entry point into the tool

- defines a basic set of cmd-line args in run.py that should encompass

its basic usage (note though that it's not comprehensive, and we'll

likely add more args as it's developed)

- adds functionality to fetch + update the recipe bundle at run-time;

the bundle will be placed at //tools/utr/.bundle/



Bug: 41492688

Change-Id: Ibf26fd301347dc1111c214324cbcd21eb267d537

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5277969

Reviewed-by: Struan Shrimpton

Reviewed-by: Garrett Beaty

Reviewed-by: Dirk Pranke

Commit-Queue: Ben Pastene

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1260816}

entry.title: infra: Also add src-internal's notifiers handling to builders.star
entry.content:
https://crrev.com/c/5282543 was the first attempt at migrating

all infra/config/lib/ builder-related features in src-internal to

src. Some notification behavior that was needed in src-internal wasn't

copied over by accident. So this copies it over.



This behavior is (uniquely?) needed by src-internal since there are

some internal builder groups that have a module-level default with

some notifiers. But then some builders in that group explicitly

set "notifiers = None" to opt it out of all notifiers.



So this tries to keep that special "None" behavior for the notifier

field.



Bug: 324765530

Change-Id: I0e951dd57d66d43c8e954f5e9f1d48579a54ccc3

entry.title: [Default Apps] Mark WebAppManagement::kApsDefault as user uninstallable
entry.content:
kApsDefault is a new management type for default apps installed through

the App Preload Service. These apps are intended to be

user-uninstallable, but this was accidentally missed during original

implementation.



This fixes a crash when attempting to uninstall such an app through App

Management.

entry.title: [FspCache] Add a permanent watcher on root
entry.content:
The CloudFileSystem should add a recursive watcher on root whenever

there's a ContentCache. This means that the Cloud file system provider

will send notifications whenever there have been changes on the Cloud.

All notifications go through CloudFileSystem::Notify().



This is important so that the CloudFileSystem can know whether its

ContentCache is out of date.

entry.title: media/gpu/ip_factory: Add output storage type parameters
entry.content:
When called, ImageProcessorFactory::CreateWithInputCandidates(), sets

the ImageProcessor input and output frame storage type based on some

assumptions about how the VideoDecoderPipeline works.



For example, when an ImageProcessor is needed to convert images from

MM21 to NV12 on Mediatek devices, the input storage type is set to

STORAGE_DMABUFS to align with the StorageType used when the V4L2Queue

constructs a frame from a V4L2 buffer. For converters, the output

storage type is set to STORAGE_GPU_MEMORY_BUFFER to align with the

VideoDecoderPipeline frame pool.



The image processor tests and perf tests align with this policy and

tests pass correctly today. This CL chain changes the frame pool

output type from STORAGE_GPU_MEMORY_BUFFER to STORAGE_DMABUFS. However

this happens over a series of commits.



To accommodate these changes, a parameter is being added to

CreateWithInputCandidates() for the output frame storage type. The

*ForTesting() functions use STORAGE_GPU_MEMORY_BUFFER, which allows the

test code not to change.



Bug: b:277581596

Test: Encode, image processor, and decode tests pass on Cherry

Change-Id: I11bad5464c860b28a70b3ee44f32a26640304d4c

entry.title: [Remote Playback] Change Cast overlay button visibility
entry.content:
This CL makes the following changes:

(1) When the cast overlay button is hidden for autoplay muted videos,

the button appear on tap and click only. Previously, the button appears

on pointerover and pointermove, which is distracting on sites using

background videos on desktop.

(2) Hide the cast overlay button explicitly if the conditions for

showing the cast overlay button aren't satisfied. Previously, the

cast overlay button is hidden when the hide media controls timer fired

or when Remote Playback isn't available. As a result, the overlay

cast button appear when it shouldn't.

entry.title: Revert "Add notifyEvent API for fenced frames."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 62f8e1eb2e54597cacc165645e888c6b89229826.



Reason for revert:

virtual/fenced-frame-mparch/external/wpt/fenced-frame/notify-event-invalid.https.html is flaky across multiple platforms, and this CL

is shown within the suspected range.

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests/141362/overview

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Win10%20Tests%20x64/88121/overview



Original change's description:

> Add notifyEvent API for fenced frames.

>

> This API allows DOM events that occur within a fenced frame

> to be observed by the frame's embedder in a privacy-respecting manner.

> When an eligible event type (currently, just click) occurs within

> the embedded document, window.fence.notifyEvent(e) can be called

> with the event object, which will create a censored version of

> the event to be handled by the embedder via addEventListener().

>

> This API is being implemented as part of the "fenced frames with

> local unpartitioned data access" proposal, see explainer here:

> https://github.com/WICG/fenced-frame/blob/master/explainer/fenced_frames_with_local_unpartitioned_data_access.md

>

> Design doc for this CL is here:

> https://docs.google.com/document/d/1EiysMPnARSx2pzI1hSeFlI7k2ETxs5ycZoV2Cy08PEk/edit?usp=sharing

>

entry.title: Fade hub panes when switching between panes.
entry.content:
This mirrors the old tab switcher logic of a sequential 120 ms fade

out followed by a 120 ms fade in that the RecyclerView provided.

However now we switch between two RecyclerViews, and we implement the

fade ourselves.



The basic idea is that we fade out the old pane's root view, and fade

in the new pane's root view. However the panes were previously

responsible for drawing a background color, and fading the background

does not look right.



To solve this we now move the responsibility of drawing background to

the pane host, and the tab list code stops when Hub is enabled.



Bug: 319144954

Change-Id: I252d226db454563d3b4292a66875c730360aebeb

entry.title: [Mac] Fix Webshare
entry.content:
This CL fixes a crash in a mac pwa when navigator.share is invoked.

SharingServicePicker is dealloc-ed when out of scope and the mojo callback is killed before the callback is invoked crashing the app shim process. The fix is to make it a strong member to RenderWidgetHostNSViewBridge so it does not get cleaned up.



The browser however does not crash but the share picker behavior is flaky and sometimes just keeps on waiting for the callback.



This Cl also updates the position of the share picker to be next the cursor to improve the UX (similar to what Safari does).

entry.title: Enable Widevine CDM rollback on Linux/ChromeOS
entry.content:
Component Update allows for downgrading components to an earlier

version. However, on Linux and ChromeOS, the Widevine CDM needs

to be loaded before the zygote is locked, and thus uses a hint

file to determine which version is supplied by Component Update.

Current checking in cdm_registration uses the larger of the bundled

version or the Component Updated version (if both exist), so if the

downgrade is to a version prior to the current bundled version, the

rollback doesn't work.



To fix this, the hint file created when a new component is downloaded

is updated to keep track of the bundled version at the time it was

downloaded, as Component Update will check the bundled version when

determining if a new version is required. If the bundled version

matches this saved version, then the bundled version is skipped when

checking what should be loaded into the zygote (thus always loading

the Component Updated version).



Bug: 1518051

entry.title: [omnibox] Remove NOTREACHED() and throw out invalid starter pack ids.
entry.content:
Currently, when there is an unknown starter pack ID, we reach a

NOTREACHED(). This presents a problem when trying to expand the starter

pack since someone running a newer version of chrome (e.g. on Canary)

will have the new starter pack entry loaded in their database. If they

then sync that profile to an older version of Chrome (e.g. stable),

that entry will persist despite the codebase not recognizing it as a

potential ID.



This CL removes the NOTREACHED() since logging an invalid ID is less

catastrophic than causing a user's chrome to crash. It also adds a

check to throw out any invalid starter pack entries that come down

from sync.



Bug: 41494524, 325307771

Change-Id: I44465089e435a56567378896866cda5220230376

entry.title: build: Switch Android from -Oz to -Os
entry.content:
This adds 800 kB to binary size.



In return, we get:

* Fewer build configs for platforms with many users. Chrome/CrOS

builds also use -Os (see internal go/cr-os -- that doc also makes

the point that speedometer is already manually tweaked with

optimizer flags and isn't the best thing to look at when comparing

perf between optimizer flags) and I think on Windows,

/O1 also basically maps to -Os

* One less thing the people working on bounded iterators have to

keep an eye on. (And we can try undoing this in a year to see

if it was an issue.)

* Possibly better performance for some non-hot code (maybe startup)?



We're keeping Fuchsia on -Oz since Fuchsia is extremely sensitive

to binary size and doesn't seem to care too much about performance.

(It configures this in a somewhat hard to find spot instead of

in the gni file that sets optimize_for_size:

build/config/fuchsia/size_optimized_cast_receiver_args.gn)



Bug: 40249335

Binary-Size: Expected 800 kB binary size growth on low-end Android.

Change-Id: I8a1c91e1442e21c4238fab87978e836d9a2d4238

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3586402

Reviewed-by: Andrew Grieve

Commit-Queue: Nico Weber

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1260749}
